intro: Pentacme siamensis var. mekongensis, commonly known as the Mekong pentacme, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
